result.execSummary:
The defendant Mark C Gromer was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Resisting or Obstructing an Officer, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 946.41(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Costs to be paid at $25.00 per month commencing 03/01/2016 and each month thereafter or penalty of 9 days jail, consecutive for non-payment.
Sentence credit of 19 days were granted. Time Served.

Case16CT0049 was dismissed and read in.

  Defendant to provide DNA sample, if not yet provided,   immediately if in custody otherwise within (3) business days at the Waukesha County Sheriff Department.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Mark C Gromer

defendant.name: Gromer, Mark C
defendant.address: S18w36017 E Ottawa Ave, Dousman, WI 53118

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: with Elements of criminal offenses to which plea is being entered.

Defendant Mark C Gromer in court with Attorney Amber K. Rumpf.  David John Behm appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant enters a guilty plea to Count #1.  Court performs plea colloquy and finds Defendant guilty of Count #1.  Repeater enhancer is stricken.  State gives sentencing recommendations.  Attorney Rumpf makes statements regarding sentencing.  Defendant makes statements.  Court sentences the Defendant to the following:

COUNT #1:  IMPOSED SENTENCE OF:

COUNT #1:  19 Days Jail - (19 Days credit)  -  TIME SERVED -   

COSTS:  $243.00 & $200.00 DNA surcharge (to be paid at $25.00 per month, commencing 3/1/16, alternate 9 days jail if not paid) 

**Defendant to provide DNA sample, if not yet provided, immediately if in custody otherwise within (3) business days at the Waukesha County Sheriff Department.**

Absolute sobriety, defendant is not to possess or consume any alcohol.  Defendant to have no contact with Aurora Summit Hospital listed in the Criminal Complaint unless it is in an official capacity. Defendant to meet with probation agent upon release and comply with any probation requirements.

Defendant Mark C Gromer in court, in custody, with attorney Amber K. Rumpf.   Brian J. Juech appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Case called for Bail Motion hearing. Atty Rumpf request to have bond converted to signature bond. State objects. Court will grant request. Court sets signature bond at $1000.00.  Hearing scheduled for February 1, 2016 at 08:30 am.
(Orig.) ... for bail modification. Filed by Atty Rumpf.

Defendant to comply with I.D. Processing.  Absolute sobriety, defendant is not to possess or consume any alcohol.  Defendant to have no contact with Aurora Summit Hospital listed in the Criminal Complaint unless it is in an official capacity.

Defendant Mark C Gromer in court, in custody.  Ted S. Szczupakiewicz appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court advises of right to an attorney.  Defendant is not eligible for State Public Defender representation.  NOT GUILTY PLEA ENTERED BY COURT.
  Hearing scheduled for January 5, 2016 at 08:30 am.
Waukesha County Pretrial Screening Services Report by Wisconsin Community Services filed.
